website_summaries.verdict: People in dire need of a Merrell boot that provides meteoric comfort accessible from day one may find such in the Moab FST 2 Mid Waterproof. Those who are seriously desperate for a mid-top hiking shoe with a true-to-size fit and outstanding water protection may also find it in this gear. Purchasers, however, must take heed of the questionable construction of its lace loops and tongue. Overall, despite its criticisms, the Merrell Moab FST 2 Mid Waterproof has more than enough merits to be deemed worthy of the trail, rain or shine.
pros: The Moab FST 2 Mid Waterproof was hailed as a remarkably comfortable boot by nearly everyone who reviewed it
Based on a multitude of reports, this Merrell gear runs true to size
Some consumers were able to break in this boot successfully in just a few days
Its unwavering waterproofing stunned several wearers
The footgear’s unbelievable lightness floored a couple of reviewers
An owner was charmed by the Moab FST 2 Mid Waterproof’s attractive looks
cons: One tester wasn’t too pleased with one of the hiker’s lace loops coming off after just a day’s use
A user found the footwear’s tongue somewhat ineffective against intrusive debris

customer_reviews.title: No break in needed.
customer_reviews.text: Needed extra ankle support for aggressive terrain with rocks and tree root exposure. Very lightweight with superior traction provided by Vibram outsole. These are my 4th pair of Merrell hiking shoes/boots. Merrell has never disappointed, outsole traction, midsole cushion, and insole arch support all work for my feet. Traveled after a rain and water proofing worked like a charm. No blisters no funny smells no out of the ordinary foot fatigue.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph Ernst

customer_reviews.title: Back to the drawing board
customer_reviews.text: This boot could be the best with some minor improvements. I really wanted to like these but just couldn't get past how the laced up. Pros: Very lightweight, 5mm lug provides good traction Cons: Ankles felt very loose and I could not get a tight snug fit. Top lace can be a bit of a pain and the boot felt wide open at the top.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Husband loves these
customer_reviews.text: Husband is on his feet all day (warehouse manager) and says these are one of the mostly comfortable shoes he’s worn yet. Wanted a second pair for outside of work.
customer_reviews.author: RLY811

customer_reviews.title: Mother of Nothin’
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to replace the Merrell Capra Bolt, which are no longer being made I guess. Those have survived 3 years of tough use, so I of course assumed the MOAB would be the same. Wrong. Hardly worn and one of the lace eyelets broke off. Disappointed by Merrell, but not by Amazon’s customer service (full refund). Will have to find some Capra Bolts on eBay or something....
customer_reviews.author: bkroo

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable but the top hook for the laces is a ...
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable but the top hook for the laces is a pain. It will be impossible to lace them if they should come undone in icy or snowy conditions. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Wolfpax

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived earlier than scheduled and the shoes are the right size. I love my merrells. I have been wearing them for some years now and buy a pair about every year or two. Thank you for the speedy service.
customer_reviews.author: Wendell

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful for dust and mud terrains, the megagrip sole by vibram is great on both
customer_reviews.author: Gus

customer_reviews.title: Half Dome
customer_reviews.text: With only 5 city mile of breaking in time I took there boots on a 20 mile hike to the top of Half Dome and back. The boots were awesome!!! Great grip on all terrain without any blisters or foot pain. It was a 13 hour hike and these boots helped make the experience that much more enjoyable.
customer_reviews.author: Wanye1

customer_reviews.title: this is not a Merrell shoe
customer_reviews.text: I had an older pair of these Merrell moab's and they fit nothing like these new ones. the's new ones are tiny the squish Your Feet arch support is crap and it doesn't go up as high as the old ones I don't understand what . horrible
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy, fits well, comfortable on hikes. Only downside is feet get a little to hot when the weather warms up. Better in the cold.
customer_reviews.author: Todd R. Dimes

customer_reviews.title: All day comfort
customer_reviews.text: I am a postal carrier and have worn the merrell pulsate model for years. They no longer make the generation 1. The fxsts2 are a perfect option. Great fit truly water proof. So comfortable on all terrain. Highly recommended. Thanks Merrell
customer_reviews.author: Brent matzke

customer_reviews.title: There comfort
customer_reviews.text: Best shoes I’ve ever had. So comfortable. Kinda warm but it’s summer now. And super sticky. I use these for roofing shoes. Lol. Yea. Really good support
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Wrong size
customer_reviews.text: Advertised as size 12 but very small. Also they looked previously worn
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Leighton

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe
customer_reviews.text: Love the look of these. I use them for rain and snow, and so far my feet have been warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Yugunda Hatchell

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe. Own a farm in ct. go up one size they run small.
customer_reviews.author: David Perrelli

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for mountain hikes
customer_reviews.text: There a are great boot, waterproof and perfect for hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Collett

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes!
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and keep my feet dry. Fit a bit snug initially until broken in
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Sparks

customer_reviews.title: A shoe
customer_reviews.text: I run a lawn service and bought these shoes a few years ago. Let’s start off saying this is the nicest shoe i owned. They lasted about two years of nasty hard work! I Maintained about 40-50 lawns a week about 7 months of the year. Very comfortable shoe. They kept my feet pretty dry in some nasty storms. Their a very lite shoe. Very sporty look i liked. I wear a 10.5, but in these shoes i needed an 11. Such a nice shoe years later, i hunted two pair of these down and bought them for more years of beatings. I love them!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I put off falling into the "Merrell-crowd for a decade. I finally bought my first set last year and have bought 2 more since. These MOAB FST 2 are as advertised and well worth the money if you wear a boot like this 100 plus hours a week. Great in wintery mix BS weather.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Barton

product_meta.title: Merrell Men's Moab FST 2 MID Waterproof Hiking Shoe
feature_bullets: Vibram MegaGrip for the best combination of traction and durability on wet or dry surfaces
Kinetic Fit BASE insole is contoured like your foot and provides flexible, intuitive support for connected and protected movement
